Key Arguments: The proposed bill excludes government members from its provisions, which the author argues is a fallacy.
Excluding government members implies they are not subject to the Australian Constitution, which is incorrect as they are required to be Australian citizens.
Changing the Constitution to accommodate such an exclusion would be a complex process requiring referendums.
Notable Quotes: Excluding Government is tantamount to saying members of the Government are not Australian citizens and therefore not subject to the Australian Constitution.
To exclude members of the Government as Section 2-27(e) does would require a change to our Constitution and all that it entails - referendums etc.
